name: staging
content:
staging noun
(PERFORMANCE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] the performance of a play or show: The production is a modern staging of the fairy tale "Cinderella".

staging noun
(ORGANIZING AN EVENT)
[ U ] the activity of organizing an event: The agreement provides for the staging of three concerts each year for three years. He loves the razzamatazz that surrounds the staging of the US Open.

staging noun
(OF CANCER)
[ U ]
  medical
  specialized the process of finding out what stage of development a cancer is at: Cancer staging is used to assess the degree of spread of the cancer from its place of origin. Their research will improve the diagnosis and staging of cancers.
